title: Complications of Paroxysmal Nocturnal Hemoglobinuria
author: Stephanie Watson

content: Red blood cells carry oxygen to your organs and tissues. These blood cells get created in your bone marrow. That's the soft tissue in the center of your bones. Normally your body breaks down red blood cells when it doesn't need them anymore.

When you have paroxysmal nocturnal hemoglobinuria (PNH), the disease damages new red blood cells and they break apart too soon. Your doctor may use the word "hemolysis" to describe the cells breaking apart. When red blood cells open up, they release hemoglobin, the protein that helps them carry oxygen.

As PNH damages more red blood cells, it can lead to complications like blood clots and anemia. There are treatments you can talk with your doctor about that can stop the breakdown of red blood cells and help keep these complications from happening.
About 1 in 3 people with PNH get blood clots. Usually, these clots are in the liver, brain, and belly.

About 1 in 3 people with PNH get blood clots. Usually, these clots are in the liver, brain, and belly.

sections.heading: Blood Clots
content: Clots are sticky clumps that form in your blood. A clot is good when you cut yourself, because it stops the bleeding. But if a clot forms when you don't need it, it could block the flow of blood to your heart or brain, which could be dangerous.
If you have PNH, you can have symptoms like:
If you have any of these things, get medical help right away.
bullets: Numbness or weakness on one side of your body

associated_bullets: Numbness or weakness on one side of your body

content_blocks.text: If you have any of these things, get medical help right away.

sections.heading: Anemia
content: This is a lack of healthy red blood cells to carry oxygen to your organs and tissues. The destruction of red blood cells in PNH causes hemolytic anemia. It's a type of anemia where your body destroys red blood cells faster than it can make new ones.
Symptoms of anemia include:

Many people with PNH have another type of anemia, called aplastic anemia. This is when your body doesn't make enough new blood cells for your body to work normally. People with aplastic anemia get tired and bleed more easily than usual.

Many people with PNH have another type of anemia, called aplastic anemia. This is when your body doesn't make enough new blood cells for your body to work normally. People with aplastic anemia get tired and bleed more easily than usual.

sections.heading: Acute Myeloid Leukemia (AML)
content: In rare cases, PNH can turn into the blood cancer leukemia. It's not clear why this happens.

People with PNH get a type of leukemia called acute myeloid leukemia (AML). It affects the bone marrow and blood. Acute means the cancer comes on quickly. Their bone marrow makes lots of abnormal blood cells that don't work as they should. AML causes a drop in:
Common symptoms of AML include:
bullets: Red blood cells that carry oxygen
White blood cells that protect your body from infections
Platelets that help your blood clot
More bleeding and bruising than usual

sections.heading: Myelodysplastic Syndromes (MDS)
content: People with PNH may also have myelodysplastic syndrome (MDS). It's a group of conditions in which your bone marrow doesn't make enough healthy blood cells. People with MDS don't have enough blood cells in their body.

content_blocks.text: People with PNH may also have myelodysplastic syndrome (MDS). It's a group of conditions in which your bone marrow doesn't make enough healthy blood cells. People with MDS don't have enough blood cells in their body.

sections.heading: Pulmonary Hypertension
content: The hemoglobin that red blood cells release can damage blood vessels. Over time, that can lead to pulmonary hypertension -- high pressure in the blood vessels of your lungs. When the blood pressure in your lungs is high, your heart has to work harder to pump enough blood to your body.
Symptoms of pulmonary hypertension include:
Pulmonary hypertension can cause long-term problems. So it's important to talk to your doctor if you have symptoms like these.
bullets: Swelling in the ankles or legs

When the blood pressure in your lungs is high, your heart has to work harder to pump enough blood to your body.

content_blocks.text: Pulmonary hypertension can cause long-term problems. So it's important to talk to your doctor if you have symptoms like these.

sections.heading: Erectile Dysfunction
content: Erections mainly involve the blood vessels. Common causes of erectile dysfunction in men are high blood pressure and conditions that block blood flow to the penis.

content_blocks.text: Erections mainly involve the blood vessels. Common causes of erectile dysfunction in men are high blood pressure and conditions that block blood flow to the penis.

sections.heading: Kidney Disease
content: Reduced blood flow through the renal artery can hurt kidney function and lead to kidney disease. A complete blockage of blood flow to the kidney can often result in permanent kidney failure.

content_blocks.text: Reduced blood flow through the renal artery can hurt kidney function and lead to kidney disease. A complete blockage of blood flow to the kidney can often result in permanent kidney failure.

meta_description: PNH damages red blood cells, causing complications like blood clots and anemia.
